title: Ability Checks
content: An ability check tests a character's or monster's innate talent and training in an effort to overcome a challenge.

title: Saving Throws
content: A saving throw—also called a save—represents an attempt to resist a spell, a trap, a poison, a disease, or a similar threat.

title: Attack Rolls
content: When you make an attack roll, you roll a d20 and add the appropriate modifiers.

title: Armor Class (AC)
content: Armor Class represents how well your character avoids being wounded in battle.

title: Movement and Positioning
content: Movement is measured in feet. During combat, you can move up to your speed as part of your action.

title: Spellcasting
content: Spellcasting is the ability to cast spells. Each class has unique rules on how spells are learned and cast.

title: Conditions
content: Conditions alter a creature's capabilities in a variety of ways and are described in detail in the game rules. Examples include blinded, charmed, and poisoned.

title: Combat Round
content: A combat round consists of turns, with each participant taking a turn in order, usually determined by initiative.

title: Resting
content: Resting is crucial to allow characters to regain abilities. Short rests take at least an hour, while long rests are 8 hours.

title: Death Saving Throws
content: When a character drops to 0 hit points, they must make death saving throws to avoid dying.
